attributes.action: I would  like to ask you  to stop the clean air zone .
attributes.additional_details: My son has had to pay 3 times for just trying  to get to work  to earn  a living  for real things people  need in life  like food rent bills getting  to work  at the right time  so as you  don't  lose  your  job  😒 not paying for air thats no different  to anywhere  else  in England the whole  thing is so very  rong.
attributes.background: It's wrong to charge  people  for to drive into Birmingham  when the air there is the same as anywhere  else 🙄 there is no bubble around  Birmingham  City centre

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about clean air zones are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition Birmingham City Council directly: https://www.birmingham.gov.uk/info/20146/consultation_and_engagement/702/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Remove local authority powers to introduce LTNs, CAZs, LEZs and ULEZs: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/637517
